description.narrative:
Restless Development focuses on addressing the needs and aspirations of young people and creating an enabling environment for inclusive engagement and participation of young women and men in economic development and decision making processes.
The organisation also works with partners to address gaps in youth rights, capacities and wellbeing. Its work focuses on three thematic goals – economic empowerment; voice, accountability and participation; and non-discrimination in SRHR. The organization creates and implements grassroots programs to deliver targeted results under each thematic goal to its target groups. In the next five years, Restless Development intends to reach at least 500,000 young people across 18 regions of Tanzania. It targets to serve 5,000 youth groups and networks engaged at the community and district level, 600 young volunteer leaders, and 1,200 alumni.
This decision proposes the third phase of Swedish support to Restless Development Tanzania for the period of 2016–2021. The overall budget for the five year period is 15.8 million GBP (approximately 209 MSEK). The Embassy’s appraisal is for proposed funding of 46.5 MSEK which is about 22.2% of the total budget. This decision covers three components of the contribution as outlined below - Component 1: 5117009701 Restless Development SP 2016-2021. Component’s budget 45 000 000 SEK at 9 000 000 per year. - Component 2: 5117009702 End of Programme External Evaluation. Component’s budget 1 000 000 SEK for 2021. - Component 3: 5117009703 Audits. Component’s budget 500 000 for 2016.
The new phase of support will enable the organization to (i) strengthen and scale-up its employability, livelihoods and enterprise programs through partnering with the private sector; and (ii) scale the girls’ leadership and rights programmes, and participation and accountability work.
Sida’s support will be channeled through Restless Development Tanzania who is the agreement and implementing partner.

Restless Developments ämnar bidra till att uppfylla unga kvinnors och mäns aspirationer om inkluderande och meningsfullt deltagande i ekonomisk utveckling och beslutsprocesser.
Organisationen arbetar också med partners för att stärkta rättigheter och ökad kapacitet och välbefinnande för ungdomar. Dess arbete fokuserar på tre tematiska mål – ekonomisk egenmakt; deltagande och ansvarsutkrävande; samt icke-diskriminering och SRHR. organisationen utvecklar och implementerar gräsrotsprogram för att bidra till resultat inom varje tematiskt område för dess målgrupp. Under de kommande 5 åren, ämnar Restless att nå 500 000 ungdomar i 18 regioner i Tanzania. De har som målsättning att stödja 5000 ungdomsgrupper och nätverk på lokal och distriktnivå, 600 ungdomsvolontärer och 1200 alumni medlemmar.
Beslutet föreslår en tredje fas av svenskt stöd till Restless Development i Tanzania för perioden 2016-2021. Den totala budgeten för femårsperioden är 15.8 miljoner GBP (ca 209 MSEK). Ambassadens beredning är av svenskt stöd på 46.5 MSEK, vilket är ca 22.2% av den totala budgeten. Beslutet omfattar tre komponenter i bidrag enligt nedan - Komponenten 1: 5117009701 Restless Development SP 2016-2021. Komponents budget 45 000 000 kronor på 9 000 000 per år . - Komponenten 2: 5117009702 End of Programme External Evaluation. Komponents budget 1 000 000 kronor på 2021. - Komponenten 3: 5117009703 Audits. Komponents budget 500 000 kronor på 2016.
Den nya fasen gör det möjligt för organisationen att (i) stärka och skala upp sitt arbete kring anställbarhet, försörjningsmöjligheter för ungdomar och företagsprogram genom samarbete med den privata sektorn; och (ii) skala upp program för ledarskap, deltagande och ansvarsarbete för unga kvinnor.
Det svenska stödet kommer kanaliseras genom Restless Development Tanzania som är både avtals och implementerande partner.

description.narrative: During the strategic period, REPOA implemented various research projects and support activities to fulfil its mission and strive to reach its vision. For the year ended December 2018, REPOA implemented 18 of a planned 22 research projects. REPOA continued to strengthen its resolve to generate knowledge for better policy results. During the year, this was done by increased rigour in conducting policy, contextually relevant and original research; disseminating and promoting the use of research findings; creating spaces for enhanced dialogue involving research, academia, policy and the citizenry; and training of researchers and research users. An example is the Growth and Economic Opportunities for Women (GrOW) project which is implemented over a three-year period. The project delved into examining the impact of Tanzania Social Action Fund (TASAF) programme on women economic empowerment in Tanzania. Findings showed that while TASAF was able to empower women on tasks within the sphere of its conditional cash transfers, that empowerment could not be translated broadly into women empowerment in areas outside TASAF domain. Findings further indicated that qualitative factors such as religion, culture and the law had a big (negative) impact on the status of women empowerment in Tanzania, suggesting a need to supplement TASAF programme with relevant programmes and actions that would truly help emancipate women economically. To a large extent, this project was completed, but it was carried forward in the 2019 financial year to produce two further briefs. Moreover, the closing workshop was be delivered in Dodoma by early 2019 where the Swedish Ambassador give a speech as Sweden supports both REPOA and TASAF through the Feminist Foreign Policy.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
